intro: Amanoa almerindae, commonly known as the Almerinda amanoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or near water bodies. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
